outputs.output_descr:
Project Outputs:
1. The Rural Growth Programme inception phase is completed
2. Improved capacities of local governance actors particularly at Rayon and Jamoat levels   for local economic development planning, implementation and monitoring  
3. Producers/farmers and Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises have access to appropriate, professional, and sustainable business and technical advisory/extension services
4. Organized member focused business associations and their apex institutions improved their capacities to serve their members and advocate their concerns
5. Selected Sughd based adult vocational training institutions meet regional, national and international demands for better qualified labor and safe migration
6. Producers/farmers, poor, women, and Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises have access to a variety of financial products and services available from Micro Loan Funds and formal financial institutions

Project Outputs: 
1) Policy Development with the following activity results:
- Establishment and capacity building of the Inter Ministerial Coordination Group and its members;
- Legal Framework for Water Supply and Sanitation sector is improved.

Project Outputs:
1. Better opportunities and conditions for economic development, poverty reduction and improved livelihoods in targeted border communities created.
2. Improved social and community infrastructure and capacities of local communities, authorities and civil society in districts on each side of the border, for participatory decision making and planning for effective rural development, poverty reduction, improved livelihoods and cross-border cooperation.
3. Created enabling environment for good neighborhood to address common issues.

1. Access of tubercular patients and their eligible family members to business and agriculture development skills;
2. Access of rural poor including unemployed, amnestied and other vulnerable groups to business and agriculture development skills.

The main objective of the project is to provide an enabling framework to support the national preparations to the United Nations Conference on sustainable Development (RIO+20), namely to ensure the participation of the Tajikistan delegation in Rio+20 and relevant preparatory sessions, events and the conference itself as well as to support the development and publication of the preparatory materials.

The project will have three main components:
1. Knowledge and capacity of young activists in Rasht valley on access to justice and domestic violence issues is enhanced
2. Access to justice through the provision of legal aid is enhanced
3. Dialogue, Advocacy and Awareness on Access to Justice Promoted

- Efficient Rule of Law policy dialogue platform initiated as a government-civil society forum on acute legal reform and access to justice issues 
- Project Document for the main phase validated with all relevant stakeholders, including Government authorities and civil society
outputs.output_title: Access to Justice: Rule of Law

outputs.output_descr: This is a joint UN initiative to be led by UNDP and involvement of UNICEF, UNWFP, UN Women, UNODC and UNFPA. The overall goal of the program is "to Improve Economic, Food, Environmental, and Energy and Personal Security for the Population in Rasht Valley".
The project aims to strengthen conflict management capacities for dialogue in conflict-prone areas of Tajikistan
